files.README.md:
# claude-code-cookbook

Claude Code plugins for team sharing.

## Installation

```bash
/plugin marketplace add drewjs/claude-code-cookbook
/plugin install example@claude-code-cookbook
```

## Adding Plugins

1. Create plugin directory: `plugins/{name}/.claude-plugin/plugin.json`
2. Add components: commands/, agents/, skills/, hooks/
3. Register in `.claude-plugin/marketplace.json`

See [CLAUDE.md](./CLAUDE.md) for detailed conventions.
files.plugins/zeplin/README.md:
# Zeplin Plugin

MCP integration for Zeplin design-to-code workflows.

## Structure

```
zeplin/
├── .claude-plugin/
│   └── plugin.json   # Plugin metadata
└── .mcp.json         # MCP server configuration
```

## Setup

1. Get a personal access token from [Zeplin Developer Settings](https://app.zeplin.io/profile/developer)

2. Add to your shell profile (`~/.zshrc` or `~/.bashrc`):
   ```bash
   export ZEPLIN_ACCESS_TOKEN=your_token_here
   ```

3. Install the plugin:
   ```bash
   /plugin install zeplin@claude-code-cookbook
   ```

## Usage

Once configured, Claude can interact with your Zeplin projects, components, and design tokens directly.
files.plugins/playbooks-fetch/README.md:
# Playbooks Fetch Plugin

Fetch URLs as clean markdown using the playbooks CLI.

## What It Does

Claude automatically uses this skill when you need to read webpage content. Provides cleaner markdown output than `web_fetch` with:

- YAML frontmatter (title, description, url)
- Clean markdown conversion
- Efficient single-command fetching

## Installation

```bash
# Add marketplace (if not already added)
/plugin marketplace add /path/to/claude-code-cookbook

# Install plugin
/plugin install playbooks-fetch@claude-code-cookbook
```

## Usage

```
"Fetch the content from https://example.com/docs"
"Read this article and summarize it: https://..."
"Extract the text from this documentation page"
```

Claude will use `npx playbooks get <url>` to fetch the content as markdown.

## Options

- `--json` — Output JSON metadata instead of raw markdown
- `[outKeyword] [outPath]` — Optional output location

## Learn More

See [@iannuttall's original post](https://x.com/iannuttall/status/2017237629008249128) introducing the playbooks CLI.
